active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, debate how inaccurate or incomplete time and billing records could jeopardize the chain of custody in a digital forensics case and affect expert testimony admissibility under standards like Daubert or NIST SP 800-61. Provide real-world examples from cybersecurity incidents.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in Digital Forensics and Case Management. Topic: 'Time and Billing Records' (Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > 002_Incident Response And Forensics > Digital Forensics > 014_Reporting and Expert Testimony > Case Management > Time and Billing Records). Incorporate these elements: - Learning Objectives: [INSERT FULL LIST FROM ABOVE] - Active Learning: Use for scenario-based cards. - Scaffolding: Distribute flashcards: 25% Layer 1, 25% Layer 2, 25% Layer 3, 25% Layer 4. - Key Facts/Best Practices: 1) Log date, time in/out, detailed task, category, personnel. 2) Critical for chain of custody timestamps and admissibility. 3) Align with NIST SP 800-61 IR phases. 4) Tools: Timesheet software, forensic case managers. 5) Pitfalls: Incomplete/vague logs lead to billing disputes/legal challenges. - Concept Map: Time/Billing → IR Phases (Prep/Detection/Analysis/Containment/Eradication/Recovery) → Chain of Custody → Reporting/Testimony → Billing Compliance. - Sources (Verified, accessed Oct 2023): NIST SP 800-61r2 (https://doi.org/10.6028/NIST.SP.800-61r2), NIST SP 800-61r3 (https://csrc.nist.gov/pubs/sp/800/61/r3/final), NIST SP 800-86 (https://doi.org/10.6028/NIST.SP.800-86), NISTIR 8374 (forensics reporting). Generate 50 high-quality flashcards following this exact schema: Front: [Question] --- Back: Answer: [Correct] Explanation: [Rationale + NIST ref + Bloom's level + distractor corrections] Bloom Level: [LEVEL] Source: [URL/Ref] Layer: [1-4] For MCQs: 4 options (1 correct, 3 distractors per protocol). Vary formats for active recall. Ensure university-level rigor, measurable via Bloom's. Output as numbered list.
